title: Tegetec
subtitle: Industrial Food Processing Equipment Provider
duration: Approx. 2 working days build, 1 month elapsed

overview.challenge: Tegetec's existing website had outdated visuals, thin SEO coverage, limited accessibility, and dense technical content with no clear information architecture. The project had a fixed budget of approximately 20,000 DKK and a hard requirement to maintain near-zero mail downtime during the domain transfer.
overview.solution: We delivered a full-stack solo project: a comprehensive UX and SEO audit, restructured information architecture with three primary navigation sections, a static Nuxt 4 build to eliminate backend costs, comprehensive Schema.org markup, EU cookie consent with GTM consent-mode, and a carefully planned DNS cutover to protect mail continuity.
overview.outcome: Tegetec launched a modern, compliant B2B platform with a refreshed visual identity, clear navigation for their technical content, and a solid SEO foundation. The static deployment means minimal ongoing hosting costs, and GTM/GA4 is in place for data-driven decisions once traffic accumulates.

keyMetrics.label: Build time
keyMetrics.description: Approx. 1 month elapsed with domain and mail transfer

process.description: We began with a thorough review of the existing site, identifying issues with UX, visual design, SEO coverage, and accessibility. We benchmarked against OEM partner materials and aligned on clear goals: modernize the design, clarify navigation for technical content, tighten SEO hygiene, and ensure ongoing support post-launch.

We restructured the site into three primary sections: Equipment and Solutions (system cards, process flow, chubmaker specs), Collaborators, and About/Contact. We added dedicated downloads and policy pages, with anchors for service and contact flows. The target audience covers food and industrial producers across Denmark, Finland, and Spain.

We built with Nuxt 4, @nuxt/ui, Tailwind CSS v4, and @nuxt/image for static site generation. Custom design tokens, accordion patterns, and table layouts handle deep OEM specs without overwhelming buyers. Local fonts and long-cache headers keep the site fast, and there is no client-side theming to add runtime overhead.

We implemented comprehensive Schema.org markup covering WebSite, Organization/Service, AboutPage, and CollectionPage. Every page has custom titles, descriptions, keywords, and OG/Twitter cards. The GDPR cookie layer features a prominent reject-all option and script gating before GTM loads. Accessibility features include skip links, focus-visible styles, reduced-motion handling, semantic tables, and screen-reader labels.

challenges.title: Domain Transfer with Mail Continuity
challenges.problem: Transferring the domain while maintaining near-zero email downtime required careful coordination of DNS and MX records.
challenges.solution: We planned the DNS cutover in advance to protect MX records throughout the transfer, coordinating timing with the client to minimize any service interruption.

challenges.title: Technical Content Without Overwhelming Buyers
challenges.problem: Tegetec's equipment specifications are detailed and technical, but the site also needs to be approachable for buyers who are not engineers.
challenges.solution: We used accordion and table patterns for deep specs, and card and stepper layouts for process overviews. This allows progressive disclosure so users can go as deep as they need without the page feeling dense.

challenges.title: GDPR Compliance Within Budget
challenges.problem: Delivering a fully compliant cookie consent and analytics setup within a tight fixed budget.
challenges.solution: We used GTM consent-mode with a reject-all prominent banner, ensuring compliant tracking setup without custom backend work. Script gating before GTM load keeps the implementation clean and auditable.

results.summary: Tegetec launched with a modernized visual system, clear information architecture, and a fully compliant infrastructure - all within the fixed budget and elapsed timeline. The static build eliminates backend costs, and GTM/GA4 is ready for data-driven optimization as traffic grows.
highlights: Solo delivery across audit, IA, design, development, and SEO in approximately 2 working days
Static Nuxt 4 build eliminating ongoing backend and hosting costs
Comprehensive Schema.org markup covering all major page types
Full GDPR compliance with EU cookie consent and GTM consent-mode
Accessibility features: skip links, focus-visible, reduced-motion, semantic tables
Multi-region contact setup for Denmark, Spain, and Finland

learnings: Domain transfers need careful planning to protect critical services like email throughout the process
Progressive disclosure patterns (accordions, steppers) are essential for technical B2B content that needs to serve both technical and non-technical buyers
Static site generation dramatically reduces ongoing costs for content-focused B2B sites with infrequent updates
GDPR cookie consent must feature a prominent reject-all option and load before any tracking scripts
